intro: Ruellia sarukhaniana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia sarukhaniana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
